events.message: The customer reported a rear-end collision involving their vehicle on the highway around noon yesterday.
The claim was categorised under 'Auto Accident' after reviewing the initial report and details provided.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the vehicle accident claim and to provide further assistance.
The customer was promptly notified that their auto accident claim has been received and is under review.
Requested police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates from the customer to proceed.
The customer submitted all requested documents including the accident report and repair cost estimate.
An investigation was initiated to verify the details of the vehicle collision and assess the damage claims.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and the reported damages are consistent.
A settlement offer covering the full repair costs was proposed to the customer based on investigation outcomes.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the prompt settlement proposal and the clarity of the process.
The claim was officially approved and processed for payment following acceptance of the settlement offer.
The payment for the vehicle repairs was issued to the customerâ€™s designated account without delay.
The auto accident claim was closed after confirming the customer had received payment and was fully satisfied.
All records related to the auto accident claim were archived for compliance and future reference purposes.
